meanings.definition: A group of people sharing a common profession or interests.
meanings.sent1: The photography fraternity organized a workshop for beginners.
meanings.sent2: The gardening fraternity meets every Saturday to exchange tips and ideas.
meanings.sent3: The cooking fraternity decided to have a bake-off to settle who makes the best cookies.
meanings.sent4: In the world of artists, the fraternity of painters is known for their vibrant colors and unique styles.
meanings.sent5: Joining the astronomy fraternity opened up a whole new world of stargazing opportunities.

meanings.definition: The state or feeling of friendship and mutual support within a group.
meanings.sent1: The sense of fraternity among the team members was evident during the charity event.
meanings.sent2: The fraternity among the neighbors helped them come together to clean up the park.
meanings.sent3: The fraternity between the two rival teams surprised everyone with their joint victory celebration.
meanings.sent4: The fraternity within the book club made reading sessions even more enjoyable.
meanings.sent5: The fraternity within the dance group created a supportive environment for learning new moves.

meanings.definition: An organization of male students at a college or university.
meanings.sent1: The college fraternity hosted a fundraiser for a local charity.
meanings.sent2: Joining a fraternity in university can provide a sense of belonging and camaraderie.
meanings.sent3: The fraternity brothers decided to have a movie night in their dorm.
meanings.sent4: The fraternity house was known for its legendary parties and social events.
meanings.sent5: Being part of a fraternity can offer opportunities for leadership and personal growth.
